thread.title: Aust shares lower in early trade
thread.title_full: Aust shares lower in early trade

title: Aust shares lower in early trade
text:
Fri, Jul 3, 2015, 11:41 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 4 hrs 19 mins Aust shares lower in early trade AAP â€“ 42 minutes ago Print 
The Australian share market is losing ground after three days of gains, with investors appearing cautious ahead of Greece's referendum on a bailout deal on Sunday. 
CMC Markets chief market analyst Ric Spooner said traders had been buying for several days in the belief that last Monday's falls were an overreaction to Greece's debt crisis. 
"Now we are getting close to the referendum we are seeing a safety first approach, it is uncertain with nobody knowing what the results and consequences of this referendum are going to be," he told AAP. 
The other negative issue weighing on the ASX was a 5.3 per cent fall in the spot iron ore price on Thursday to $US55.80, its lowest level since April. 
Every sector was weaker, including markets heavyweights the big four four banks and larger miners. 
Commonwealth Bank had lost 73 cents to $86.72, Westpac had shed 19 cents to $32.82, National Australia Bank fell 32 cents to $33.72 and ANZ dropped 28 cents to $32.63. 
BHP Billiton fell 33.5 cents to $26.665, Fortescue Metals lost 7.2 cents to $1.838 while Rio Tinto had given up 45 cents to $52.58. 
Meanwhile, Qantas said it would give its workforce $90 million in bonuses following a dramatic turnaround after multi-billion-dollar losses in recent years. 
Its shares were down 6.5 cents at $3.205. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1045 AEST on Friday, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 54.6 points, or 0.98 per cent, at 5,545.2 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was down 51.8 points, or 0.93 per cent, at 5,536.1 points. 
* The September share price index futures contract was down 51 points at 5,592 points, with 11,004 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 286 million securities worth $701 million. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
